author: S Poorvaja
text:
While preparations for the AIADMK general council meeting were under way on Wednesday, social media was rife with posts, pictures and videos about the event.

In a 49-second video posted on his Facebook page, M.K. Balaji, a singer, showed over 200 hoardings and banners installed on either side of the 4-km stretch from Kotturpuram to Tidel Park.

In a post accompanying the video, he says:

“This is not an anti-political video, just a (sic) frustration of a Chennai lover, seeing his beautiful city turn into a poster board.”

On Thursday, there was a steady flow of Twitter updates right from the traffic situation to concerns about the number of banners affecting traffic.

The banners which were a hindrance to pedestrians and motorists on TTK Road and hoardings encroaching pavements near the Kotturpuram junction became a topic of discussion.

The AIADMK itself tweeted out a number of photos of the council meeting from its official, verified handle (@AIADMKOfficial).
title: Social media abuzz
